properties.publicTransport:
A FREE shuttle buses will run from Canley Vale and Canley Heights to Cabramatta, from 9am until 8:30pm.


Buses will be diverting and missing stops while road closures are in place. The bus interchange at Cabramatta Station will also be temporarily relocated to Railway Pde, between McBurney Rd and Hughes St. Services will start and end their trips at the temporary stops located here. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Thousands of people are expected to attend the annual Cabramatta Moon Festival held on John St from 11am to 8pm.

Heavy traffic is expected on Joseph St, Railway Pde, Cumberland Hwy and Cabramatta Rd West as crowds travel to and from the event. 

From 8pm on Saturday the night before, sections of John Street, Cabramatta Road West, Park Road and Arthur Street in the Cabramatta CBD will be closed until midnight on Sunday. Motorists will be detoured via local roads.

Additional closures will in place on Dutton Lane and Railway Pde from midnight Saturday. 

Arthur St car park will close from 6am on Saturday until midnight Sunday, and Hughes St car park will be closed from 8pm Saturday until midnight Sunday.

Motorists are advised to allow additional travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

arrangementElements.html:
CABRAMATTA

8PM SATURDAY 27 AUGUST TO MIDNIGHT SUNDAY 28 AUGUST

  • John St between Hill St and Cabramatta Rd West
  • Cabramatta Rd West at Railway Pde
  • Park Rd between Hughes St and John St
  • Arthur St between Park Rd and Railway Pde

MIDNIGHT SATURDAY 27 AUGUST TO MIDNIGHT SUNDAY 28 AUGUST

  • Dutton Lane
  • Railway Pde between Hughes St and the Cabramatta Rd West overbridge
arrangementElements.title: Road Closures

webLinks.linkText: UCI Road World Championships 2022 - road closures

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info for more details and to plan your trip on public transport
properties.otherAdvice:
The UCI Road World Championships will be hosted in Wollongong, with eight days of competitive cycle racing from 18 to 25 September and a training day on Saturday 17 September.

Major road closures and extensive special event clearways will be in effect for the duration of the event at various times.

The M1 Princes Mwy, Memorial Dr and the Princes Hwy (except for a section in Fairy Meadow) will remain open throughout the event.

There will be closures on Lawrence Hargrave Dr, Masters Rd, Springhill Rd, Five Islands Rd and the Princes Hwy at Unanderra on Saturday 24 and Sunday 25 September only.

Towradgi Rd and Balgownie Rd will also remain open and provide a connection to the suburbs of Mt Ousley, Fairy Meadow, Towradgi and Balgownie.

Road closures for each day are displayed in the interactive maps below

  • Training - Saturday 17 September - closures from 7.30am to 12pm/5pm
  • Day 1 – Sunday 18 September - closures from 8am to 6pm
  • Day 2 – Monday 19 September - closures from 11.30am to 6pm
  • Day 3 – Tuesday 20 September - closures from 8am to 6pm
  • Day 4 – Wednesday 21 September - closures from 12.30pm to 6pm
  • Day 5 – Thursday 22 September - closures from 8am to 1.30pm
  • Day 6 – Friday 23 September - closures from 7am to 6pm
  • Day 7 – Saturday 24 September - closures between 6.45am and 3.30pm
  • Day 8 – Sunday 25 September - closures between 8.45am and 6pm

Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect on various roads along and surrounding the event courses through Wollongong and surrounding suburbs between Thursday 15 September and Sunday 25 September.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, and apply even for local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully before parking as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

roads.mainStreet: Princes Highway, Corrimal Street, Squires Way, Pioneer Drive

properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Dragons v Titans at WIN Stadium. NRL kick-off from 2pm, full-time around 4pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Burelli St, Corrimal St, Stewart St and Crown St as fans travel to and from the game.

Sections of Harbour St at the Stadium will be closed for crowd safety. Roads will re-open once crowds have cleared the area. 

Fans driving to the game should allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

NRL: Knights v Raiders at McDonald Jones Stadium. NRL kick-off at 4pm and full time approx. 6pm.

Traffic may be heavier than normal on Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd, Newcastle Rd, Lambton Rd and Bridges Rd through Broadmeadow as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

Sooshi Mango at WIN Entertainment Centre. Show start from 7pm and finishes approx 9pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads in Wollongong CBD and on local roads around WIN Sports and Entertainment Centre as fans travel to and from the event. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads around the venue.

properties.publicTransport: Buses are diverting while roads are closed. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

properties.otherAdvice:
Over 100,000 people are expected to attend the Ferragosto Italian Street Festival in Five Dock on Sunday 21 August, from 10am to 5pm.

Road closures and special event clearway parking restrictions are in place for the festival.

Great North Road is closed between Queens Road and Lyons Road until 11pm.

Special event clearways are in effect until 11pm on both sides of Great North Road between Queens Road and Lyons Road as well as on sections of surrounding streets.

Clearways are strict no parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:

properties.diversions: Motorists are diverted around the closure of Great North Rd via Lyons Rd, Ingham Ave, Fairlight St, Queens Rd and Harris Rd.

properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 8,000 participants will take part in the annual Beach2Beach Charity Fun Run and Festival from Collaroy to Newport. Events start from 8am and will finish at around 1pm at Newport Beach. Changed traffic conditions will be in effect along the course for the safety of participants.

Roads along and surrounding the course will be closed to general traffic. Access for local residents will be maintained when safe to do so after runners have safely passed by along the course.

Collaroy from 7am to 10am: Sections of Beach Rd and Florence Ave will be closed to general traffic.

Collaroy to Narrabeen from 7am to 10am: While the run is underway, there will be no general traffic access to streets off Pittwater Rd along the beachfront between Fielding St in Collaroy and Goodwin St in Narrabeen, including car parks/driveways. A reduced speed limit of 40km/h will be in place in the southbound lanes of Pittwater Rd between Alexander St and Devitt St from 5am to 10am, with a single lane closure also in place.

Collaroy to Dee Why from 7am to 10am: Southbound lanes closures in place on Pittwater Road between Anzac Avenue and 50m north of Hawkesbury Avenue. 

Warriewood from 7.30am to 11am: Roads closed with access for residents via Narrabeen Park Pde northbound:

  • Sections of Peal Pl, Melbourne Ave and Narrabeen Park Pde around Turimetta Beach.
  • Narrabeen Park Pde southbound lanes will be closed between Cook Tce and Sydney Rd, Warriewood. One-way traffic northbound only will be maintained.

Mona Vale from 7.30am to 1pm:

  • Sections of Bassett St, Orana Rd, Surfview Rd and Grandview Pde will be closed with one-way traffic arrangements in place – follow directions of traffic controllers. Access for residents will be maintained when safe to do so.
  • No parking will be permitted on the eastern side of Orana Rd and the northern side of Grandview Pde between Orana Rd and Barrenjoey Rd.

Newport from 7.30am to 1pm:

  • Sections of Ross St, Palm Rd, Myola Rd and Calvert Pde around the Beach will be closed with access for residents when safe to do so and one-way traffic arrangements will be in place – follow directions of traffic controllers.

Newport to Mona Vale from 5am to 1pm: The speed limit along the southbound lanes of Barrenjoey Rd from The Boulevarde in Newport to Grandview Pde in Mona Vale will be reduced to 40km/h with a single lane closure in place.

Special event clearways will be in place on sections of Pittwater Rd from 4am until 9:30am from Narrabeen to Collaroy, and on Barrenjoey Rd from Newport to Mona Vale from 4am until 12pm.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents, businesses and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
A reduced speed limit of 40km/h will apply in the following areas to ensure the safety of runners:


NARRABEEN TO COLLAROY – FROM 5AM TO 10AM

MONA VALE TO NEWPORT – FROM 5AM TO 1PM

  • Barrenjoey Rd between The Boulevard and Grandview Pde (Southbound)
  • Grandview Pde between Orana Rd and Barrenjoey Rd (Westbound)
  • Orana Rd between Grandview Pde and Bassett St (Northbound)

NEWPORT – FROM 7:30AM UNTIL 1PM

Restricted access will be in place from Barrenjoey Rd northbound to Newport Beach, and the eastern side of Barrenjoey Rd between Karloo Pde and The Boulevarde. Residents are advised to expect minor delays.

**Residents will have access via Narrabeen Park Pde in the northbound direction.
